columns.text: In this exercise, we are to determine the amount of external financing necessary for the financial plan.

## Financial Planning
\
Financial planning is referred to as the systematic method of the attainment of the company's financial goals. It indicates the actions and decisions to be done in the future for the company.

## Pro Forma Statements
\
Pro Forma statements include a forecasted balance sheet, an income statement, and a statement of cash flows. These financial statements are necessary for the determination of the summary of projected events in the succeeding years of operation of the firm.
\
The pro forma statements are considered outputs of the financial plan. The management would estimate the projected and would then produce the pro forma statements.

Now, let us determine the external financing needed using the following given:
 

<center>

|Given||
|:--|--:|
|Income Statement||
|$\hspace{20pt}$Sales|\$7,900|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Cost|\$5,500|
|$\hspace{30pt}$Taxable Income|\$2,400|
|$\hspace{30pt}$Tax Expenses|\$600|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Net Income|\$1,800|
|Balance Sheet||
|$\hspace{20pt}$Current Assets|\$3,900|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Fixed Assets|\$8,600|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Current Liabilities|\$2,100|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Long-term Debt|\$3,700|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Equity|\$6,700|

Now, let us prepare the pro forma income statement:
 
$$\textbf{Pro Forma}\\
\textbf{Income Statement}$$

$$\begin{array}{l r}
\text{Sales}&{\$9,085.00}\\
\text{Cost}&\underline{6,359.50}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Taxable Income}&{\$2,725.50}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Taxes}&{681.38}\\
\hspace{20pt}\textbf{Net Income}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$}\textbf{2,044.12}}}\\
\end{array}$$

Now, let us prepare the pro forma balance sheet:
 
$$\textbf{Pro Forma}\\
\textbf{Balance Sheet}$$

$$\begin{array}{l r l r}
\text{C Assets}&{\$4,451.65}&\text{C Liabilities}&{\$2,452.95}\\
\text{F Assets}&{\$9,902.65}&\text{Long-term Debt}&{3,700.00}\\
\hspace{20pt}\textbf{Total }&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$}\hspace{6pt}\textbf{14,354.30}}}&\text{Equity}&\underline{\$7,674.73}\\
{}&{}&\hspace{20pt}\textbf{Total }&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$}\textbf{13,827.68}}}\\
\end{array}$$

The total assets and the total debt and equity does not balance out based on the preceding computations. The increase in the equity which is the cash dividends is also not sufficient to balance the amounts in the balance sheet. Therefore, the company should provide additional external financing.
The problem will require us to calculate the EFN (external financing needed) of Assouad, Inc.

### Let's first provide the given data in the problem.

* Assets, costs, and current liabilities are proportional to sales.
* Long-term debt and equity are not proportionate to sales.
* The company maintains a constant 40% dividend payout ratio.
* The sales are expected to increase by 15% next year.

## Requirement.

### Compute the EFN (external financing needed).

### Compute the percentage share of the cost of sales from the sales.

Computation of the percentage share of the cost of sales is needed to compute the projected cost of sales.
$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Percentage of Cost of Sales from Sales}&= \dfrac{\text{Cost of Sales}}{\text{Sales}}\\[15pt]


\end{aligned}
$$

### Compute the cost of sales of the projected sales.

Using the calculated percentage of the cost of sales, we will use this percentage share to calculate the project cost of sales.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Projected Cost of Sales}&= \text{Projected Sales} \times \text{Percentage of COS}\\[15pt]
\end{aligned}
$$

### Compute the taxable income.

The projected taxable income will be used in calculating the business tax.

$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Description}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[10pt]
\text{Sales}&\$9,085.00\\
\text{Cost of Sales}&\underline{6,324.98}\\
\text{Taxable Income}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$2,760.02}}}\\

\end{array}
$$

Therefore, the taxable income is **$2,760.02**.

### Compute the projected net income using the Pro-forma income statement.

After computing the projected cost of sales and business tax, we can now calculate the projected net income.

The calculation is as follows.

$$
\begin{array}{c}
\textbf{Assouad, Inc.}\\
\text{Pro Forma}\\

\text{Income Statement}
\end{array}
$$

$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Description}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[10pt]
\text{Sales}&\$9,085.00\\
\text{Cost of Sales}&\underline{6,324.98}\\
\text{Taxable Income}&2,760.02\\
\text{Taxes(25\%)}&\underline{690.00}\\
\textbf{Net Income}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$2,070.02}}}

\end{array}
$$

Therefore, the projected net income is **$2,070.02**.

### Compute the projected dividend.

The projected dividend is calculated by multiplying the net income with the payout ratio. Based on the problem, the company maintains a 40% payout ratio.


The formula is as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Projected Dividend}&= \text{Payout Ratio} \times \text{Projected Net Income}\\[15pt]
& = 40\% \times \$2,070.02\\[15pt]
&= \boxed{\textbf{\$828.01}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Therefore, the projected dividend is **$828.01**.

### Compute the projected retained earnings.

The projected retained earnings are calculated by deducting the projected dividend from the projected net income.

The calculation is as follows.

$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Description}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[10pt]
\text{Net Income}&\$2,070.02\\
\text{Less: Projected Dividend}&\underline{(828.01)}\\
\text{Retained Earnings}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$1,242.01}}}\\

\end{array}
$$


Therefore, the projected retained earnings are **$1,242.01**.

### Compute the projected equity.

The projected equity is calculated by adding the beginning equity balance with the projected retained earnings.

The calculation is as follows.

$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Description}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[10pt]
\text{Equity, beg balance}&\$6,700.00\\
\text{Retained Earnings}&\underline{1,242.01}\\
\text{Projected Equity}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$7,942.01}}}\\

\end{array}
$$

Therefore, the projected equity is **$7,942.01**.

**Note:** The declared dividends are not included in the calculation of the projected equity as it is considered released to the company stockholders. The retained earnings are added to the equity calculation as it is viewed as a reserve balance.

### Compute the total projected assets.

The projected assets are calculated by adding the projected current and fixed assets.

The calculation is as follows.

$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Description}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[10pt]
\text{Proj. Current Assets}&\$4,485.00\\
\text{Proj. Fixed Assets}&\underline{9,890.00}\\
\text{Total Assets}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$14,375.00}}}\\

\end{array}
$$

### Compute the EFN (external financing needed).

Assets should be balanced with the total of the liabilities and the equity. Any difference is attributable to the EFN.

$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Description}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[10pt]
\text{Proj. Current Assets}&\$14,375.00\\
\text{Less:}\\
\hspace{5pt}\text{Current Liabilities}&(2,415.00)\\

\hspace{5pt}\text{Long-term debt}&(3,700.00)\\
\hspace{5pt}\text{Equity}&\underline{(7,942.01)}\\
\textbf{EFN}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$317.99}}}\\

\end{array}
$$

Therefore, the EFN is **$317.99**.
